description:
Oozing with Mid-century features and retaining the character, warmth and soul that buyers consistently demand.

Located in a family friendly Quiet Cul-De-Sac and gently resting in an elevated extremely sort after location. The home captures the afternoon breezes and there is hardly a better and more centralized location than this. Walking distance to Ipswich Girls Grammar School, East Ipswich Train Station and the amazing Queens Park, just a little further and you are into Ipswich CBD making this spot hard to beat.

** Opportunity for Teenagers/Older Kids, Elderly Parents, Guests or potentially a tenant paying a good chunk of your mortgage and them being able to live independently in a self-contained studio/granny flat
The Studio could also easily become the ensuited, king sized master suite or work from home Office

Ready to immediately move into:

- 3 Excellent sized bedrooms with robes in the main home
- 4th generously sized bedroom in the independent Studio/Granny flat
- Luxurious lounge/living and dining
- Large entertainers' kitchen with meals area
- Centrally located and well-proportioned main bathroom (separate toilet)
- The studio is an excellent size with more than enough room for living and bedroom space
- The studio also includes a kitchenette, the 2nd bathroom and a dual access laundry.
- Stunning front entrance verandah, facing north and with views
- Wide, double carport (tandem) possibly room for a third vehicle
- This space also doubles as a massive entertaining space as it is under the main roof
- The retainers an amazing amount of character and an inspection is a must
- Freshly painted throughout
- Covered, semi-enclosed storage room / workshop / gardening area adjacent to back-yard
- Established and maintained gardens and trees
- Water tank for garden use
- Very elevated position and Not flood affected
- Recently refurbished, including paint, carpets, window furnishing, updated electrics and lighting, updated bathrooms

Inspections are encouraged as this home really needs to be experienced in person, to truly appreciate what it has to offer.

Disclaimer: Whilst all care has been taken in preparation, no responsibility is accepted for the accuracy of the information contained herein. All information (including but not limited to the property area, floor size, price, address & general property description) within this advertisement is provided as a convenience to you, and has been provided to Raine & Horne Ipswich by third parties. Interested persons are advised to make their own enquiries, seek legal advice and satisfy themselves in all respects.

To inspect this property, please contact Richard Bird from Raine & Horne immediately to avoid disappointment.
